title: Tunisia dismisses foreign, defence ministers-statement
text:
Tunisia's Prime Minister Youssef Chahed gestures during an interview with Reuters in Tunis, Tunisia, August 29, 2019. REUTERS/Zoubeir Souissi

TUNIS (Reuters) - Tunisia’s Prime Minister Youssef Chahed has dismissed the foreign and defence ministers after consultation with the newly elected President Kais Saied, a statement on the presidency’s website said on Tuesday.

Chahed has appointed Karim Jamoussi, the justice minister, as acting defence minister, and Sabri Bachtabji as the acting foreign minister, the statement said.
description: Tunisia's Prime Minister Youssef Chahed has dismissed the foreign and defence ministers after consultation with the newly elected President Kais Saied, a statement on the presidency's website said on Tuesday.
